page.title: 02Housing.
page.content: The houses in the area are almost equally divided between owner-occupied and council owned.Older properties dating back to the end of the 19th and the early 20th century are to be found in Weaver St. Ways Green, Gladstone St.and Swanlow Lane.Most have been fully modernised.The Dene Estate was built immediately after W.W.2 for the families of returning servicemen.Consequently many of the roads were named after famous battles _Alemein Drive,Dunkirk Drive etc.Large new owner occupied estates are found in the west of the area.Also in the west the Glebe Green council estate was built in the late '60s to accomodate Liverpool overspill families who moved to Winsford under a Council sponsored scheme.During the period 1961 to 1971 the population of Winsford rose from 12,760 to 24,934.
